techmeme.title: Sources: in 2017 and 2018, Intel and OpenAI executives discussed Intel buying a 15% stake for $1B in cash, but CEO Bob Swan did not go forward with the deal (Max A. Cherney/Reuters)
The UK Online Safety Bill, set to take effect in 2025, wouldn't address anti-immigrant lies on X and Telegram that fueled riots, even before it was watered down (Parmy Olson/Bloomberg)
The UK CMA approves HPE's $14B deal to buy Juniper Networks after finding no competition concerns, following EU regulators approving the deal on August 1 (Katharine Gemmell/Bloomberg)
Shopify reports Q2 revenue up 21% YoY to $2.05B, vs. $2B est., Gross Merchandise Volume up 22% to $67.2B, and gross profit up 25% YoY to $1B; SHOP jumps 17%+ (Spencer Soper/Bloomberg)
Automattic launches Write Brief with AI, to help users write and tweak content using text prompts, in beta on Jetpack, after launching an AI assistant in 2023 (Paul Sawers/TechCrunch)
